attributes.action: Make adult adoption legal in the UK
attributes.background: Many people today do not live in traditional nuclear families; and many children form a stronger bond with a step-parent or relationship with someone of a similar nature as opposed to a biological parent.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems, for many reasons, children and their potential adopters don't get the opportunity to discuss and/or execute adoption until the child has reached legal adulthood; and by this point the UK government no longer views the said child as eligible for adoption.
The implications of this are social and legal issues that arise later in life surrounding the relationship between child and, for example, step-parent.
I believe the 2002 UK Adoption and Children Act is outdated for modern day Britain.

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether it is possible to make a success of leaving the EU.
attributes.background: The Government has repeatedly stated it is determined to "make a success" of Brexit. While 52% of eligible voters may have voted to leave the EU, mere determination to make a success out of Brexit is insufficient. The notion Brexit can be successful is not supported by evidence and must be debated.
attributes.additional_details: Potential consequences include the UK leaving the Single Market and the break-up of the UK (both contrary to pledges made in the Conservative Manifesto); a plunge in the value of sterling (which hit a 168-year low following the referendum); few trading partners (diplomats for India, Canada, the US & Australia have stated they prioritise the EU over the UK); the loss of sovereignty over Gilbratar (a red line for Spain in negotiations); no deal with the EU (the 18-month timeframe is unrealistic).

attributes.action: Protect access to state funded benefits and services for humanitarian workers.
attributes.background: Humanitarian workers who serve oversea with registered charities are discriminated against and do not have the same access to publicly funded benefits and services that UK dwelling people do. Their service in the national interest means that they no longer meet presence based qualification criteria.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of their contribution to the national interest certain categories of workers, like military personnel and public servants, have their access to benefits and service protected when living overseas in the line of duty. Thus they are treated by legislation as being physically present in the UK, even when overseas. This protection of rights to access state funded assistance or services, from discretionary or mandatory disqualification, should be extended to humanitarian workers.

attributes.action: Slash the Foreign Aid Budget by at least 50%
attributes.background:
The arbitrary target for Foreign Aid spending set by the Cameron Government of .7% of GDP is clearly not working. 

The Department is struggling to spend all of the budget. 40% ends up being thrown at the EU, the UN & NGOs where we have no control or certainty that our money is being spent wisely.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the UK Foreign Aid budge rose to £12.2bn, all of which had to be borrowed.

The Independent Commission for Aid has produced a report saying that "The DfID’s plans are “not fit for purpose” 

The National Audit Office has severely criticised the policy. In 2013 the DfID had to spend £2bn in just 8 weeks to ensure the target for spending was reached !

We have budget constraints at home, particularly with defence, the NHS and Education yet the Foreign Aid budget is ring fenced. 
Why ?

attributes.action: Focus primary school education on social skills and creativity rather than exams
attributes.background: The current curriculum focuses on tests and results. It is putting unacceptable pressure on young children. Many parents simply want schooling in primary years to focus on social skills, creativity and fun What value is there in creating highly educated but traumatised children?
attributes.additional_details: Mental health issues are soaring in children. Childline has reported a marked increase. Children face many pressures, some of which simply didn't exist for older generations. Piling additional pressures on children through rigorous testing achieves nothing but anxiety for both child and parent.

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt.
attributes.background: The budget for mental health trusts fell by 2% from 2013/14 to 2014/15. Also, in the year April 2016 the budget for mental health trusts was projected to rise by a dismal 0.3%. Jeremy Hunt is ruining our NHS, which was created after WW2 to assist people regardless of their socioeconomic background.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned call upon parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt. Arguably, Jeremy Hunt is in breach of The National Health Service Act (S1) (1a). It states 'The Secretary of State must continue the promotion in England of a comprehensive health service designed to secure improvement in the physical and mental health of the people of England'. By cutting the budget of mental health trusts Jeremy Hunt is, potentially putting patients lives at risk; not promoting the NHS.

attributes.action: Make government help fund Silverstone Circuit so they can keep hosting F1
attributes.background: Silverstone is the home of Formula One, & motor racing in general. The British Grand Prix NEEDS to be kept at this historic track to help sustain the future of the sport. It's bad enough we, the fans, are unable to watch all races live on free-to-air, so to lose this too would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/formula1/38526002

https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2017/jan/05/future-f1-british-grand-prix-silverstone-in-doubt-hosting-costs

http://www.skysports.com/f1/news/12433/10719351/silverstone-considering-terminating-british-gp-contract

attributes.action: Elizabeth Truss to use her powers of executive clemency in the cases of 500 IPPs
attributes.background:
prisoners serving  (IPP) were "languishing in jail". IPP sentences, abolished in 2012, were having a serious effect on prisoners' mental health.
More than 3,800 prisoners are serving indeterminate IPP sentences, designed to protect the public
attributes.additional_details:
Truss to resume prison officer talks
Of those, 500 should be let go, former Justice Secretary Michael Gove said, when he delivered the annual Longford lecture in memory of prison reformer Lord Longford.

Mr Gove said executive clemency should be granted to release prisoners who had served far longer than the tariff for their offence and had now - after multiple parole reviews - served even longer than the maximum determinate sentence for that offence.

attributes.action: Save Lives by regulating extreme sporting activities
attributes.background: We lost our daughter Kleyo in an nightmare incident that could have easily been prevented. Please help us to enable extreme sports seekers to have a safe adventure. Help petition our MPs and Government to work with other EU member states to tackle unregulated and unskilled operators.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=kleyo+de+abreu&oq=kleyo+de+abreu&aqs=chrome.0.69i59.8717j0j8&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8

attributes.action: Ireland Re-unification Talks
attributes.background: As part of The government's Brexit talks, there should be a discussion about a possible Re-Unification of Ireland. As Northern Ireland will now be our only physical border with the EU, some kind of border controls will have to be implemented, to stop any unrestricted movement across the UK border.
attributes.additional_details: Might I suggest that there is a clause that after a specified period of time (say six years) since we have officially left the EU, the people of both Ireland & Northern Ireland can decide whether they would like their current situation to stay the same, Northern Ireland to reunify with Ireland, or whether The Republic of Ireland would like to rejoin the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Urge the NHS to back the 8-week blood sugar diet method to avoid T2 Diabetes.
attributes.background: Increasing numbers of people are recovering from type 2 diabetes without drugs using the nutrition based 8-week blood sugar diet method at a time when instances of limb amputations, blindness and other complications are rising dramatically.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1: "The 8-week blood sugar diet method" by Dr Michael Mosley and Prof. Roy Taylor

Reference 2: Colin Beattie MSP (successful use of this method)

Reference 3: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3404259/Eat-beat-diabetes-just-eight-weeks-s-life-changing-diet-help-avoid-reverse-Type-2-diabetes-best-s-tasty-way-health.html

attributes.action: Keep tinker lane greenfield and the rest of Nottinghamshire clean from fracking
attributes.background: I am a mother to my 3 year old daughter, a farmer’s daughter and a resident of Bassetlaw. We never want to see any land used for high pressure hydraulic fracking in this area. This company is happy to gain much from this while we all stand to gain nothing.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want my daughter ingesting methane and being exposed to chemicals. We want her to have the best start in life. She is at her most vulnerable stage and for me to be able to protect her we need to stop Igas who want to destroy the land which my family and others make a living from by growing food. Polluting this greenfield land will be catastrophic on a local level and national level. This soil grows carrots, barley, wheat, peas and potatoes on it. We believe clean healthy food is important.

attributes.action: Redefine Children Act 1989 allow both biological mothers & fathers equal rights
attributes.background: Parental Responsibility (PR) as defined in the Children Act 1989 (CA 89) has caused so much misery and in extreme cases death of parents and children, there must be an equal 50/50 responsibilities and authorities in relation to the child and the child’s property for biological parents .

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cages under 80x50cm for hamsters
attributes.background:
Thousands of hamsters are kept in cages not suitable. 
According to a pet shop "a cage sized 30X59cm is the biggest cage & is suitable to keep a hamster in as they don't grow much." Incorrect advice is being given to owners & millions of hamsters are living in cages that are not actually big enough
attributes.additional_details:
This leads to physical issues, chronic stress causing untamed behaviour & sadly, even worse.

The RSPCA's guideline is 80X50cm floor space as a minimum. There are thousands of cages smaller than this being sold every day as "permanent" homes for Syrian Hamsters by uneducated staff.

Cages sold as Large (30x59cm) are too small for permanent residence, the minimum recommended size for an adult Syrian should be 80x50cm. Lets be the voice for those that cant speak & improve the welfare of hamsters.

attributes.action: Make the taking of fish from all privately owned waters a criminal offence
attributes.background: Fishing is the most participated sport in the UK, however, the illegal removal of fish from privately owned lakes is having a devastating impact on the future of all angling, the cost of replacing stolen fish is crippling local clubs and associations lakes and must be stopped

attributes.action: Authorise open book examinations for GCSE English Literature 2017
attributes.background: The introduction of closed book examinations,for GCSE English Literature,requires students to learn and memorise quotes for this exam.There are 2 literature papers which include the content of:15 poems,2 plays and 1 novella.Exams shouldn't be a test on the student's memory,but how we interpret texts
attributes.additional_details: Students are expected to remember:quotes from each character & themes and context that are incorporated within these texts- it is estimated that 250+ quotes could be potentially memorised for this exam. On top of 20+ exams,students are experiencing high levels of stress- due to the paper being more demanding for a higher grade.English is a subject that all employers & universities look at, therefore if students are unable to realistically achieve high grades- there will be lower employment rates

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: Include all domestic pets to the Road Traffic Act 1988
attributes.background: The Road Traffic Act 1988 states drivers must report incidents involving horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pigs, goats and dogs. This was sufficient for these working animals at the time the legislation was set. In contemporary times, the government should add domestic companions to this list.
attributes.additional_details: A working animal, usually domesticated, is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks which tends to give them a special status within the law. Today there are a wide range of domestic animals kept in the UK who deserve to be included in the act. For example, today Cats are successfully used as companions for the sick and disabled in care programs. They have served in the agricultural sector and in the military over many years. The Act must be updated to reflect these modern relationships.

attributes.action: Make Personal Independence Payment (PIP) claims fairer for adults with Autism.
attributes.background: Those with Autism (ASD) can find verbalising difficulties challenging. When considering PIP, the DWP should more carefully assess those with social and communication difficulties, by discussing more with medical professionals, rather than relying on the opinions of an assessor who briefly met them.
attributes.additional_details: My husband moved over from highest level care and lowest level mobility Disability Living Allowance, to the the new PIP system. He has a number of conditions including ASD and mental health difficulties, yet scored 0 on his PIP claim, and as a direct result became suicidal. Those with ASD can mask difficulties, and behaviours can vary; how can an assessment which takes place in their own home environment, with their trusted person present, be a true representation of their usual daily struggles?

attributes.action: Create awareness of Peritoneal Mesothelioma and support clinical trials for cure
attributes.background: The government must raise awareness of peritoneal mesothelioma so health professionals and the public are aware of the signs and symptoms of this rare, but increasing, disease, leading to earlier diagnosis and better prognosis for patients.they must also support clinical trials to help find a cure.
attributes.additional_details: My mum was diagnosed with peritoneal mesothelioma 2 yrs ago after 6 yrs of symptoms and numerous misdiagnoses. she was given 2 Weeks to live a yr ago but still fights on.Mums diagnosis came too late for her to have life lengthening surgery,and at every turn we are told there is nothing that can be done. Many Drs haven't even heard of the illness.No trials are ongoing for a cure because "drugs companies won't make enough money due to the relatively small number of people with the disease"

attributes.action: No Trump in the UK if he deports Muslim citizens from US with no terror links
attributes.background: We believe that the UK is a multicultural country and if Donald Trump begins to deport Muslim citizens from US with no terror links this is clearly for racial reasons. If the UK government allows him to enter this suggests that they agree with and support his policies.

attributes.action: People with permanent disabilities can apply for disability benefits immediately
attributes.background: Disabled benefits like PIP (formerly DLA), the Personal Independence Payment, make people wait 3 months before they can apply. Many other forms of help such as blue badges also require PIP as a form of proof of disability. Disabilities such as the loss of a limb should be allowed PIP immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
About PIP
https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

attributes.action: Improve funding for mental health treatment for young people in Cornwall
attributes.background: Cornwall is one of the only counties in the UK to have no dedicated mental health treatment centre for people under 18. With the government's promise of £1.4bn of extra funding for mental health, we believe there is an opportunity to tackle this silent crisis. #ThinkPositive and sign the petition.

attributes.action: Put restrictions on the amount of packaging used by British supermarkets.
attributes.background: In the light of the varied problems of climate change and waste disposal, it is inexcusable that supermarkets produce vast quantities of unnecessary packaging. Consumables, such as fruit and vegetables, confectionery and ready meals, do not need to be enclosed in multiple layers of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Estimates put our annual levels of waste from packaging at around 5 mega-tonnes, this constitutes between a quarter and a third of our domestic waste. Responsibility for disposal and recycling of over-packaging should not be put on the consumer. Packaging to enclose goods such as bananas or tomatoes is entirely avoidable whilst for other products, such as confectionery, multiple layers of packaging are often used where one would suffice.

attributes.action: Increase  healthcare spending now to a minimum of 10.6% of GDP to save our NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS and Social Care are in crisis.Staff shortages abound; ambulances wait for blocked beds, but people need care at home, and social care is missing because of Government cuts to councils.  Don't let the crisis be a tragedy, raise our spending to the level of other G7s now.
attributes.additional_details: According to the King's Fund 8/6/16 the USA, Sweden,Germany,France,Belgium,Denmark,The Netherlands,Japan,Canada,Austria all spend more % of their GDP than we do. The G7 countries spend an average of 10.6%GDP. The NHS is currently being asked to cut millions of pounds via Sustainability Transformation Strategies at a time when the whole system is in crisis.Our NHS must be protected, it is the one thing which stands for Britain, that all citizens,no matter how poor,have access to free healthcare.

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.

attributes.action: Drivers caught using a mobile phone whilst driving 6 penalty points. £1000 fine.
attributes.background: I have been an undertaker for many years. I have witnessed the aftermath and carnage whilst attending fatal crashes, where driver has been distracted by using mobile phone and lost control. The percentage of motorists using phones has risen!!! in the past 5 years. They are laughing at the law.
attributes.additional_details: I still remember attending a fatality where the driver had driven into back of lorry...his mobile phone still connected to the call.

attributes.action: Create a bottle deposit scheme for the UK similar to those used in Scandinavia.
attributes.background: The deposit return scheme sees a small deposit (approx. 10p) added to the cost of a drinks container which is refunded when the container is recycled. The impacts in terms of energy costs and CO2 emissions can be considerable. The scheme also helps to reduce littering and it's environmental impacts.
attributes.additional_details: Sweden offers a world-leading example of how to deal with waste from drinks bottles and cans.  The scheme has resulted in recycling rates of more than 90 per cent of its drinks containers. Recycling glass can save 80 per cent of raw materials mined and, with recycled aluminium saving 95 per cent of the energy it takes to make new aluminium. The success of the 5 pence levy on single-use plastic bags proves that these kinds of policies can work well in the UK.

attributes.action: More democracy at work: let workers elect representatives to company boards
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister announced her support for a change in company law to allow workers to elect representatives to sit on company boards.

But this welcome proposal for corporate governance reform has been watered down. 

This is unacceptable - democratic representation should not be voluntary.
attributes.additional_details:
“If I’m prime minister ... we’re going to have not just consumers represented on 
company boards, but workers as well.”  - Theresa May, 11th July 2016

Worker representation is not a replacement for existing agreements between companies and trade unions. Nor is it a means of reducing the independence unions.

The TUC has published a report on how the policy could be implemented: https://www.tuc.org.uk/economic-issues/corporate-governance/workplace-issues/all-aboard-making-worker-representation

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: End unlawful detention without trial for political opponents in Bangladesh
attributes.background: Since 2009 the Bangladesh government have been purging members of opposition parties, in particular the Bangladesh National Party (BNP).  In August 2016 Hummam Chowdhury and Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem with links to the BNP, were picked arrested and continue to be unlawfully detained without trial.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK government to put diplomatic pressure on the Bangladesh government and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to immediately end the detention of political opponents of the Awami League Party and release Mr Chowdhury and Mr Bin Quasem.  The UK government should do everything it can to prevent further human rights abuses in Bangladesh and should consider pressing for sanctions with the international community if this practice persists.

attributes.action: Rectify a disparity in MOD regulations over the use of Unit badges on memorials.
attributes.background: The three Services have their own rules for which names, Crests or Unit Badges can be used on private, family instigated memorials and/or their headstone, post mortem. The Royal Navy and Army state that any amount of service is acceptable, where as the RAF can require as much as 20 years service

attributes.action: Stop the Boundary Commission splitting Great Grimsby into two constituencies
attributes.background: Parliamentary boundaries define the area where a person votes for their local MP – their parliamentary constituency. A boundary review examines these areas and makes proposals for a new set of boundaries which are fairer and more equal, while also trying to reflect GEOGRAPHIC FACTORS and LOCAL TIES.
attributes.additional_details: The Boundary Commission’s proposal to cut our historic town completely down the middle therefore makes no sense, separating the famed docks in East Marsh Ward from the centrepiece People’s Park in Park Ward and the River Freshney in Freshney Ward from the ancient village in Scartho Ward. The proposal is unfair, undemocratic and unacceptable and is based on an out-of-date version of the electoral register. Sign this petition and keep the town of Great Grimsby in one seat.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for event tickets to be sold at more than Face Value.
attributes.background: Over the past 15 - 20 years it has become almost impossible to buy an event ticket for Face Value, companies like Ticketmaster etc are ticket touts of the worse kind. Not only do they increase the cost of the ticket they also add extra's e.g. handling fee, transaction costs, delivery.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent example: GetMeIn a Ticketmaster company: 2 x £55 Robbie Williams Tickets. £97.90 each, plus £35.88 transaction fee. Total for two tickets £231.68 
THIS IS DAYLIGHT ROBBERY & SHOULD BE ILLEGAL
Surely the venue has agreed on the original ticket price and this price has been set to cover all costs and overheads, therefore who, in this particular case benefits from the extra £121.68
Sporting Events:  VIVAGO ar offering Six Nations Tickets for Wales v England £75 tickets for £190 each

attributes.action: Refund child maintenance if DNA testing proves a man isn't the biological Father
attributes.background:
My husband recently discovered that the child he has been raising for almost six years is not biologically his, following DNA testing.

As the Mother had always maintained that he was the father, he has been paying maintenance through the CSA for five years. 

He has no legal right to a refund.
attributes.additional_details:
The only way to attempt to get the money back is by claiming fraud in court which is costly, time consuming and not guaranteed. 

This is totally unfair and I believe the Mother should have a legal obligation to pay this money back via an attachment of earnings or a deduction of benefits, in the same way that Father's are forced to pay maintenance by the government.

Please sign this petition to have the issue debated in parliment, and bring about change in a system which unfairly favours women.

attributes.action: Reopen the railway line between Calne and Chippenham
attributes.background: The branch line between Calne and Chippenham was closed in 1965, and with Calne constantly growing, and more and more people working in Chippenham (or elsewhere requiring further travel from Chippenham Station), a single carriage train running backwards and forwards seems a good idea.
attributes.additional_details: For more information on the old Railway line visit: http://www.railuk.info/lines/getline.php?id=1

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to increase flat rate VAT to 16.5%
attributes.background: The Chancellor announced in his Autumn statement flat rate VAT will increase to 16.5% from April 2017. This means for a business such as my own there will typically be an additional 4.5% per year tax on gross turnover. The increase is not justified placing an additional tax only on small businesses.
attributes.additional_details:
The flat rate VAT scheme was introduced to help small businesses simplify VAT reporting by reducing the need to complete a full VAT return and in turn help HMRC by reducing their workload checking full VAT returns.
The proposed change will mean that many businesses will withdraw from the flat rate scheme placing a new and increased burden on HMRC in receiving and managing their full VAT returns. Sadly some small businesses will not survive the imposition of the new tax charge.

attributes.action: Election Manifestos of political parties must become legally binding contracts
attributes.background: The Parties publicly declare their policies that they promise to deliver if elected into office this is the Election Manifesto. There is no legal mechanism in place besides general/local elections to hold parties to account. Election Manifestos should be made into legally binding contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
If a elected government, local council, elected mayor or assembly breaks the contract they've delivered to the electorate. The party in question should be taken to the British Courts if found guilty the punishment should be a fine the payment would be from the parties own funding and not from the tax payer to deter uk parties from purposefully deceiving the electorate.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/notesandqueries/query/0,,-203998,00.html

http://www.thefreedictionary.com/Electoral+manifesto

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Make handfasting a legal ceremony
attributes.background: The tradition of handfasting has been practiced for thousands of years pre-dating any wedding ceremony concocted by any modern religion/faith. These have their marriages recognised by law and there is no good reason why this same right should not be extended to include Pagan faiths.
attributes.additional_details:
The Marriage (Scotland) Act 1977 made Pagan weddings and handfastings legal in Scotland, allowing Norse, Druids & other Pagans to obtain legally recognised marriage ceremonies in accordance with their faith, but at present Pagans in England & Wales do not have that right.
We request that the government recognise how important it is for people to be able to be joined in matrimony in accordance with their religious beliefs and give Pagan handfasting legal recognition in England and Wales without prejudice and without having to have a second ceremony to legalise the commitment.

attributes.action: Decommission Trident missiles.
attributes.background: When the NHS is under immense strain, it is appalling to know that the single nuclear Trident warhead that missed its target zone cost the UK £17,000,000. Trident is also far more an aggressor than a defense, so I urge everyone who sees this- In the name of Peace and Prosperity, help disarm Trident!
attributes.additional_details: The single missile that failed cost £17,000,000- the same cost as the cost of employing 700 nurses for the NHS a year- it is already strained, with pregnant women having to wait up to 4 hours to be seen. This was lied about in Parliament and so it is fair to have it debated again.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action:
Save HMS Hermes.
Rescue her from the scrap yard and bring her home.
attributes.background:
HMS Hermes served for over 30 years and was the flag ship during the Falklands conflict in 1982. She has been recently decommissioned by the indian navy and is now destined for the scrap yard.
She is a significant piece of the Royal Navy's history in the same class as HMS Victory and HMS Belfast.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Hermes could become a great floating museum and business and educational centre.

attributes.action: GOVT Ban all existing & proposed PSPOs affecting quality of life of dog owners
attributes.background: Borough councils are waging Total War against dog owners by abusing the Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO). PSPOs are grossly abused by councils to impose wide restrictions against and affect the quality of life of a SINGLE demographic. HMGovt ban all orders preventing off lead exercising of dogs
attributes.additional_details: PSPOs are intended to prevent Criminal & Anti-Social behaviour, e.g. a PSPO can be used to gate a community to prevent persistent anti-social offences like burglary, violence, drinking & drugs. PSPOs are not intended to penalise, criminalise and demonise dog owners wishing to provide humane exercise to their dogs. Councils even raise PSPOs against Town and Village Greens (‘TVGs’) & Public Rights of Way affecting the quality of life for millions of people. HMG ban all such orders immediately

attributes.action: Fireworks - ONLY SOLD to the public with licence from Local Council @ £50.
attributes.background:
Sale of FIREWORKS - The way forward
a)  To purchase FIREWORKS public need to obtain a licence from their Local Council.  Licence should be at least £50, dates avail on a website.
b)  People need to use Facebook/media as a Communication tool to let others know about forthcoming firework displays.

attributes.action: Investigations offered for all miscarried babies regardless of gestation.
attributes.background: Miscarrying a much loved and wanted child is heart breaking.  It is a life changing event that leaves the parents, especially the mother, with many unanswered questions.  Often guilt is felt and not knowing WHY is very damaging both psychologically and emotionally.  Testing will bring understanding
attributes.additional_details: Testing is not routinely offered unless a lady has had 3 or more miscarriages, or her loss happens in the second or third trimester.  As miscarriages happen in 1:4 pregnancies this leaves a very high percentage of women with questions and unimaginable pain.  The not knowing WHY is often the hardest to come to terms with.  Many miscarriages do have an underlying reason and for the parents who have lost their baby this is vital information that would help them.  They have the right to know WHY.

attributes.action: Get the government to licence the use of PD-1 immunotherapy to treat cancer
attributes.background: I was shocked to learn of a 36 year old woman who had to pay £50K for this to treat secondary lung cancer following treatment for Breast Cancer. It should be available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My Oncologist agrees it works.

attributes.action: Stop the delay in welcoming lone refugee children.
attributes.background: Save the Children originally asked for 3000 unaccompanied refugee children to be allowed into the UK. After an amendment, which changed this to an “unspecified” number of children, was added to the bill, it became part of the Immigration Act in May 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
It is stated that around one unaccompanied refugee child is accepted into the UK every 18 days. These children have a perilous journey and only some are lucky enough to make it to a camp. 

Many of these children are being used as sex slaves and even have their organs sold. 50% that were tested in Italy had sexually transmitted diseases. 

The purpose of this petition, is to demand the government act immediately to bring these children to the UK in far greater numbers than just TWENTY per YEAR!
